intro: Scilla climacocarpha, commonly known as the mountain scilla, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, forming a basal rosette. Scilla climacocarpha is typically found in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
